title: Towards a prioritised use of transportation infrastructures: the case of vehicle-specific dynamic access restrictions to city centres. (arXiv:2401.12329v1 [physics.soc-ph])
abstract: One of the main problems that local authorities of large cities have to face is the regulation of urban mobility. They need to provide the means to allow for the efficient movement of people and distribution of goods. However, the provisioning of transportation services needs to take into account general global objectives, like reducing emissions and having more healthy living environments, which may not always be aligned with individual interests. Urban mobility is usually provided through a transport infrastructure that includes all the elements that support mobility. translated_title: 迈向交通基础设施的优先使用：城市中心车辆特定动态进入限制的案例研究
translated_abstract: 大城市地方政府所面临的主要问题之一是城市交通管理。他们需要提供有效的人员流动和物品分配手段。然而，交通服务的提供需要考虑到普遍的全球目标，如减少排放和创造更健康的生活环境，这与个体利益并不总是一致。城市交通通常通过包括支持流动性的所有要素的交通基础设施来提供。在许多情况下，这种基础设施要素的容量低于实际需求，因此不同 的交通活动会竞争使用它们。在本文中，我们认为稀缺的交通基础设施要素应以动态和优先的方式分配给从社会角度来看具有较高效用的交通活动；例如，产生排放减少和创造更健康生活环境的活动。
tldr: 这项研究提出了一种基于社会效益的动态优先分配稀缺交通基础设施的方法，以解决城市交通问题。
en_tdlr: This research proposes a method to dynamically prioritize the allocation of scarce transportation infrastructure based on social utility, aiming to address urban mobility issues.
